definition: breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]
in an instant a myriad changes (idiom); rapid substantial change
in the wink of an eye/in a flash

sentences.english: Because we cannot accept the truth of transience, we suffer.
sentences.chinese: 我們無法接受瞬息萬變這一真理，因此我們爲之痛苦。

sentences.english: Crops grown on irrigated land are not dependent on the vagaries of the weather.
sentences.chinese: 生長於灌溉農地的作物不依賴於天氣的瞬息萬變。

sentences.english: All these are fast water lotus.
The satellite disappeared in a wink .
sentences.chinese: 瞬息之間，那顆衛星就消失了。

sentences.english: Life as we know it can change in the blink of an eye.
sentences.chinese: 生活就如我們所想象那般，眨眼間瞬息萬變。

sentences.english: Capital and technology are transferred from one place to another within seconds.
sentences.chinese: 資本和技術在不同地區之間瞬息轉移。

sentences.english: How many little things that cross your mind at any given minute, unconsciously bother you and exhaust your spiritual energy?
sentences.chinese: 你曾否留意每一個瞬息間腦子裏閃過多少念頭。

sentences.english: The objective world is constantly changing.
sentences.chinese: 外面世界是瞬息萬變的。

sentences.english: Summits are higher and can be very windy, and the weather can change on a dime.
sentences.chinese: 峯頂比較高，風會很大，天氣也是瞬息萬變。

sentences.english: The more things seems to change, the more they seem to stay the same.
sentences.chinese: 事物越是看似瞬息萬變，其實它們越是恆久不變。

sentences.english: In a instant, Black Rose had run back and stood motionless in front of the girl.
sentences.chinese: 瞬息之間，黑玫瑰已奔到了那女郎身前，直立不動。

sentences.english: You cannot burn the candle at both end.
sentences.chinese: 蠟燭兩頭點，瞬息即燒完。

sentences.english: Unsurprisingly, Young would soon retreat from the runaway success of this album.
sentences.chinese: 揚能很快從這張專輯瞬息的成功中退避出來不足爲奇。

sentences.english: The political landscape was changing as quickly as a fast-moving computer game.
sentences.chinese: 政壇風雲變幻之迅速如同瞬息萬變的電腦遊戲。

sentences.english: Her feeling of fear was only momentary ; it soon passed.
sentences.chinese: 她的懼怕感僅是瞬息間的，很快就消失了。

definition: in the wink of an eye/in a flash
in the twinkling of an eye/in a flash/to turn one's eyes
one instant/very short time/the twinkle of an eye
in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
a snap of the fingers/a short moment/in a flash/in the twinkling of an eye
to blink/to wink/in the twinkling of an eye
